text: The Master of Andlau () is the notname given to an Alsatian Romanesque sculptor and his workshop, active in the middle of the 12th century. The Master's name derives from the relief sculptures of the main portal and the frieze around Andlau Abbey church. Fragments of other works by the Master are housed in the Musée de l’Œuvre Notre-Dame in Strasbourg and in the Unterlinden Museum in Colmar. == Gallery == Andlau Abbatiale092.JPG|Detail of the Andlau portal Andlau Abbatiale115.JPG|Detail of the Andlau portal Andlau Abbatiale110.JPG|Detail of the Andlau frieze Andlau Abbatiale085.JPG|Detail of the Andlau frieze == References == == See also == *Master of Eschau Category:People from Bas-Rhin Category:12th-century sculptors Category:Medieval German sculptors
title: Master of Andlau
